conclusion: For motion in one dimension, acceleration as a function of displacement satisfies a(x) = v dv/dx.
Integrating from the starting position (x = 0, v = 0) to any later position x gives ½ v² = ∫₀ˣ a(x) dx.
From x = 0 up to x = x₁ the graph shows a constant acceleration a₀.

premise: The graph shows a constant acceleration a₀ from x = 0 to x = x₁.
conclusion: Over this interval the integral of a(x) with respect to x is simply a₀ x₁.

premise: ½ v(x₁)² = ∫₀ˣ₁ a(x) dx = a₀ x₁.
